name: Another Look At the 'Curious' Multiple Choice Quiz | General | 10 Questions

questions.text: Sightings of 'Bigfoot' in the U.S. tend to predominate where?
questions.explanation:
Pacific Northwest.

	He-she-it roams the Northwest and Western Canada.

questions.text: Many people believed that Troy was a myth - until it was discovered and excavated by whom?
questions.explanation:
Heinrich Schliemann.

	Great tale of refusing to admit defeat.

questions.text: Many people have heard about a place called 'Area 51' or 'Dreamland'. This area is located near where?
questions.explanation:
Groom Lake.

	Groom Lake it is - but what goes on there?

questions.text: In the middle of the 20th century, a book received substantial publicity when its author claimed to have hypnotized a woman and regressed her back in time to a point where she 'remembered' a past life. This woman was known as ___.
questions.explanation:
Bridey Murphy.

	'The search for Bridey Murphy' enjoyed a certain fame for a while.

questions.text: Nostradamus is well-known to everyone. When did he live?
questions.explanation:
16th century.

	His life spanned the first half of the 16th century (more or less).

questions.text: The author who sparked a great deal of interest in the near-death experience with his popular bestseller, 'Life After Life' was whom?
questions.explanation:
Raymond Moody.

	Fascinating stuff to read!

questions.text: The bold thief who parachuted out of a plane over the Northwest and disappeared was commonly known as ___.
questions.explanation:
D. B. Cooper

	Never to be seen again.

questions.text: The 'Lost Colony' of American colonial days was located where?
questions.explanation:
Roanoke Island.

	The only clue was 'croatoan', carved into a tree.

questions.text: Name the 18th century philosopher whose life was radically changed when he claimed to have had supernatural and religious experiences.
Which form of E.S.P. has been most closely studied, particularly in experiments involving twins?
questions.explanation:
telepathy.

	Telepathy - the other three round out the realm of e.s.p.
